intro: Aceras caprinum var. calcaratum, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. This variety is noted for its hardiness and ability to withstand cold temperatures, making it a common sight in high-altitude flora.
